meanings.definition: To make noble or elevate in character
meanings.sent1: Helping others and being kind can be very ennobling.
meanings.sent2: She felt ennobling emotions when she volunteered at the shelter.
meanings.sent3: The cat's attempt to wear a crown was quite ennobling.
meanings.sent4: His words had an ennobling effect on her spirit.
meanings.sent5: The sunset painted the sky in ennobling shades of gold and pink.

meanings.definition: Having a noble or dignified effect
meanings.sent1: The ennobling music filled the room with a sense of grandeur.
meanings.sent2: Her ennobling presence commanded respect from all who met her.
meanings.sent3: The puppy's attempt at a royal pose was surprisingly ennobling.
meanings.sent4: The old castle stood on the hill, a silent ennobling sentinel.
meanings.sent5: The ennobling statue of the great leader inspired all who passed by.

meanings.definition: The act of bestowing honor or dignity upon someone
meanings.sent1: The ennobling of the brave soldier was celebrated by the whole town.
meanings.sent2: She received an ennobling title for her selfless acts of kindness.
meanings.sent3: The ceremony to honor the mayor was a grand ennobling affair.
meanings.sent4: The queen's ennobling of the young artist brought tears to his eyes.
meanings.sent5: The ennobling of the old library with a new wing brought joy to the community.
